content.description: The furthest left hand problem on the northwest face.  Sit start and climb some interesting, patina-like features.  Great problem.  I thought the crux was off the ground.

Climb up and right of

Kinky

.

Start as for

Rockin' Bod

, traverse left on jugs to some slopers, and finish on the topout of

Kinky

. This has fun, sustained moves.
content.location: It is on Victoria's Secret starting on the far right side.

content.description: Start just to the right of the V2 under a little roof.  Climb straight up the northwest face.  I saw someone pop a pulley on this problem, and I will never forget that sound.  Warm up properly.

Start with hands matched on a low, slopey rail.  Upgrade to a higher rail and work your way left toward the prow.  Take care not to dab on the rocks underneath you.  Stretch for a great left-hand crimp just around the arete.  Upgrade your right onto another good rail.  Pull up and right to rock your weight over your foot, then stand up and top out.

This problem is fun because it's overhung at the start, but it's got great holds and feet.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  There are large jutting rocks directly underneath the starting portion of the climb.  Also, there is a larger rock behind you that you could tumble into if you fall wrong.  Don't fall when your are topping out, as you will be falling into a 2-foot crack and will probably bounce back and forth between the opposing walls and probably roll your ankle.  It's not really feasible to spot inside the crack.
content.location: This problem starts just right of the the Victoria's Secret Boulder's southwest corner.  It is just barely inside the crack between the two boulders.

content.description: Begin with a high start with your hands on the base of an overhang and your left heel high to the side. Move up to a small pinch or to a higher crimp. Bring your right hand and up to a good hold and then bump it to a good jug.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Seduction

and to the left of

Kinky

on the corner.

content.description: Match both hands on a diagonal crimper rail.  Stem your foot out across the dihedral to your left.  Tension your body, lock your right off and reach for a good sloper.  Now get your feet underneath you and finish straight up.  You could escape out left pretty easily, but that wouldn't be as fun as donkey kicking over the lip--contrived, I know.
content.protection: A pad or two.  This is not a tall problem.
content.location: This is on the east face of the Victoria's Secret Boulder.  The starting lip is just to the left of the obvious black streak running up the boulder.

content.description: On the west side of the boulder, start sitting on two in-cuts and using a pocket, trend left up the face on good holds.

Start with the left hand on a side pull and right hand around the corner of the arete. Heel hook the right foot around the corner as well and throw for the good 4 finger ledge. Match on the ledge and keep going up. Fun, powerful move.
content.location:
This is on the corner arete of the Victoria's Secret Boulder, just left of

Victoria

.
